intro: Parianella carvalhoi, commonly known as the São Paulo nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom at night. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its fruit is a small, berry-like structure that turns red when mature. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
